intro: Euryops gracilipes, commonly known as the slender coastal dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, showing a preference for well-drained environments. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Euryops gracilipes is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
